meanings.definition: The act of cleaning something by scrubbing or rinsing it with water.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy doing the washings of my car every weekend.
meanings.sent2: She used gentle washings to clean the delicate fabric.
meanings.sent3: The washings of the muddy shoes turned the water brown.
meanings.sent4: After the heavy rain, the streets were covered in the washings of dirt and debris.
meanings.sent5: The washings of the dishes were done quickly to avoid any stains.

meanings.definition: Liquid that has been used for washing.
meanings.sent1: The bucket was filled with soapy washings for cleaning the windows.
meanings.sent2: He spilled the washings from the laundry detergent all over the floor.
meanings.sent3: The washings from the cleaning solution smelled like fresh lemons.
meanings.sent4: The washings of the car shampoo left a shiny finish on the vehicle.
meanings.sent5: She poured the washings of the dish soap into the sink to wash the dishes.

meanings.definition: The residue left after washing something.
meanings.sent1: The washings of the soap left a white film on the glass.
meanings.sent2: He wiped away the washings of the cleaning solution with a cloth.
meanings.sent3: The washings of the detergent clung stubbornly to the fabric.
meanings.sent4: The washings of the shampoo left a pleasant scent in the bathroom.
meanings.sent5: She carefully removed the washings of the paint from her hands.
